resources.string: Touch this button to show a colour chooser screen for the background colour and opacity of the widget.
Touch this button to show a colour chooser screen for the text colour of the %1s.

This screen provides sliders to set the hue, saturation, value, red, green, blue, and opacity values of the colour of the widget\'s background. You can also type in values for any of these except the hue.
This screen provides sliders to set the hue, saturation, value, red, green, and blue values of the colour of the %1s\'s text. You can also type in values for any of these except the hue.
Move the thumb on this slider to set the hue. This will not modify the value or saturation. Black, white and grayscale colours have a saturation of zero, so changing their hue will have no effect.

Move the thumb on this slider to set the saturation. This will not modify the hue or the value. Decreasing the saturation increases the amount of white in the colour: pale pink is unsaturated, while pure red is saturated.

Move the thumb on this slider to set the value. This will not modify the hue or the saturation. The value is approximately the brightness of the colour, but we use different names for some low-value colours: for example low-value red is brown.
Move the thumb on this slider to adjust the amount of red in the colour.
Move the thumb on this slider to adjust the amount of green in the colour.
Move the thumb on this slider to adjust the amount of blue in the colour.
Touch this button to show a colour chooser screen for the colour of the full screen clock.
